EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at (0.0, 0.0) paired with a Burner Inserter at (1.5, 0.5).
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at (5.0, 0.0) with an associated Burner Inserter at (3.5, 0.5).
• Common Input Chest:
 – Wooden Chest at (2.5, 0.5) stocking copper-plate.
• New Feeder Inserter:
 – Feeder Inserter at (2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5).
• Transport Belt Connection:
 – BeltGroup linking mining output at (-14.5, -47.5) to the feeder inserter pickup at (2.5, -1.5) using 64 belts.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at position (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill:
 – Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0) with output drop at (-14.5, -48.5).
• Drill Inserter:
 – Drill Inserter at (-13.5, -47.5) transferring ore.
• Output Sink & Extraction System:
 – Updated Sink Chest: Wooden Chest now placed at (-13.5, -51.5) (a new placement attempted in step 199 replaces the original location).
• Supplemental Burner Inserter:
 – Burner Inserter at (-13.5, -52.5) with pickup at (-13.5, -53.5) and drop at (-13.5, -51.5).
• Belt Connection Attempts:
 – Multiple strategies (direct L-shaped path and segmented connections) to connect the transport belt from the mining drill drop (-14.5, -48.5) to the burner inserter pickup (-13.5, -53.5) have failed due to invalid path normalization and buildability conflicts.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Belt Connection Errors:
 – When establishing belt connections, verify that both endpoints and all waypoints are grid-aligned and fall within buildable areas. In these attempts, paths from (-14.5, -48.5) to (-13.5, -53.5) failed normalization; ensure that computed endpoints match the intended targets.

• Sink Chest Placement and Candidate Computation:
 – Directly placing a sink chest at the mining drill drop (–14.5, –48.5) failed because the tile was not buildable. Always validate the buildability of a candidate tile before placement.
 – When computing candidate positions (for example, via a nearest-buildable approach), ensure that properties (like candidate_box.center) are accessed correctly and that the resulting position is manually verified for buildability.

• Repositioning and Prototype Consistency:
 – Repositioning attempts using the shift_entity_local function encountered prototype mismatches (e.g. comparing "wooden-chest" with "WoodenChest"). Standardize prototype identifiers to prevent such errors.

• Proximity Requirements:
 – Placement actions failing due to distance (the “too far” error) were remedied by moving the player closer to the target area. Always ensure proper proximity to the intended build location.

• General Entity Placement:
 – Confirm that the target tile is vacant, within the allowed range, and adheres to the grid before attempting to place any entity.

NAMESPACE
─────────
• shift_entity_local(entity: Entity, offset: Tuple[float, float]) -> Entity  
 – Shifts the given entity’s position by the specified offset.  
  • Invocation notes: Used for repositioning sink chests; errors arose when prototype strings did not match expected values.

• nearest_buildable(position: Position) -> BoundingBox  
 – Determines the nearest buildable area around a given position for placement of an entity.  
  • Invocation notes: Incorrect usage (treating candidate_box.center as callable) led to a TypeError; ensure properties are accessed correctly.

Important Variables:
• furnace_input_chest_pos (Position) – Holds the position of the furnace input chest.
• current_player_inventory (Inventory) – Tracks the current state of the player’s inventory.
